intro: Lagenophora platysperma, commonly known as the broad-seeded bower vine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, flat seeds. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Lagenophora platysperma is often found in disturbed habitats and is used in traditional medicine in some regions.
